intro: Laserpitium eliasii subsp. ordunae, commonly known as the Orduna hawk's-beard, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It has small, elongated leaves and produces numerous flower heads that bloom in late spring to early summer. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
